meanings.sent1: She needed to excide the damaged part of the fabric.
meanings.sent2: The chef had to excide the spoiled section of the fruit before using it in the salad.
meanings.sent3: The tailor accidentally excided too much material from the dress, making it too short.
meanings.sent4: The gardener excided the overgrown branches, shaping the tree into a beautiful form.
meanings.sent5: The surgeon carefully excided the tumor to ensure complete removal.

meanings.sent1: He had to excide the thorns from the rose stems before arranging them in a vase.
meanings.sent2: The barber excided the split ends from her hair, leaving it healthy and smooth.
meanings.sent3: The sculptor excided excess clay to reveal the intricate details of the sculpture.
meanings.sent4: She excided the unnecessary paragraphs from her essay, making it more concise.
meanings.sent5: The jeweler excided the flawed gem from the setting, replacing it with a flawless one.

meanings.sent1: The storm excided the power lines, leaving the town in darkness.
meanings.sent2: The wildfire excided the entire forest, leaving only charred remains.
meanings.sent3: The careless gardener excided the delicate flowers while trimming the bushes.
meanings.sent4: The vandals excided the artwork on the wall, leaving a blank canvas behind.
meanings.sent5: The chainsaw excided the old tree, echoing through the silent forest.
